oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Order authorizing E. H. Cook to keep a US-branded mule taken by units of Forrest's cavalry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Postwar document concerns a re-branded mule--Confederates apparently had branded a flat stamp over the "US" brand after the animal was captured by Confederate cavalry under Col. Dibrell or Williams, part of Forrest's command
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
